title: ESA Boosts Deep-Space Comms Capacity with Cryocooled Upgrade
summary:
The European Space Agency’s deep-space communications station in Spain has been upgraded, boosting its download capacity. Deep space networks are facing an unprecedented demand for communication bandwidth from space agencies around the world and, increasingly, from private companies. One of the ways that ESA is working to meet this demand is by adding a fourth […]
The post ESA Boosts Deep-Space Comms Capacity with Cryocooled Upgrade appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Viasat preparing to start services from hobbled ViaSat-3 satellite
summary: Viasat expects to start providing Wi-Fi to planes by the end of June from ViaSat-3 F1, the satellite that lost more than 90% of its 1 terabit per second capacity after an antenna deployment failure last year.

title: Venture-backed space companies face “year of reckoning”
summary: The aftermath of a “bubble” of investment in space startups in recent years could cause many companies to struggle to raise additional funding even as overall market conditions improve.

title: JPL Lays Off Eight Percent of Workforce Amid Budget Uncertainty
summary: NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory announced today that it is laying off 580 people, 8 percent of its workforce, plus contractors, because Congress has not passed FY2024 appropriations. One of JPL’s […]

title: Launch Roundup: SpaceX to launch lunar lander on Falcon 9’s 300th mission; JAXA looks to reach orbit with H3 rocket
summary: On the week of the sixth anniversary of the first flight of Falcon Heavy, SpaceX looks to launch four separate Falcon 9 missions. Meanwhile, JAXA is preparing for the second flight of the H3 rocket after its unsuccessful maiden launch in 2023, while Roscosmos will resupply the International Space Station (ISS) with Progress MS-26 launching on Soyuz.

title: JPL to lay off 8% of workforce
summary: NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory announced Feb. 6 it will lay off 530 employees, about 8% of its staff, citing uncertainty about its budget for 2024.

title: Space VCs urge startups to pursue government contracts but stay focused on commercial success
summary: While venture capital has retrenched, “the government has stepped up and created a tailwind for the space industry."

title: Virgin Galactic and the FAA are investigating a dropped pin on last spaceflight
summary: "The FAA is overseeing the Virgin Galactic-led mishap investigation."

title: Spectrum for the Space and Satellite Industry
summary: The recent World Radiocommunication Conference (WRC-23) in Dubai saw regulators and industry players from across the globe attempt to shape the future of telecom, satellite and space applications.

title: Daily Telescope: A stunning new image of Io reveals a volcanic plume
summary: Juno continues to deliver in the Jovian system.
